sentences.en: an enterprise with a turnover of $26 billion
Catering may now account for close on a quarter of pub turnover.
sentences.cn: 承办酒席现在可能占酒吧营业额的近1/4。
她的年营业额大约是4.5万英镑。

sentences.en: How do you account for the company's alarmingly high staff turnover?
sentences.cn: 你怎么解释这家公司高得令人忧虑的人员流动率？

sentences.en: I believe they've doubled their turnover since those advertisements appeared in the press.
sentences.cn: 我相信，那些广告在报上刊登出来后，他们的营业额已经翻番。

sentences.en: Our turnover actually increased last year.
sentences.cn: 去年我们的营业额竟然增加了.

sentences.en: Profit margins have been slashed to the bone in an attempt to keep turnover moving.
sentences.cn: 为了维持资金周转，利润率已被降为最低。
短期合同使得员工流动率增高。

sentences.en: Staff turnover is particularly high among junior grades.
sentences.cn: 基层职员的流动率特别高。

sentences.en: The company had a turnover of $3.8 million.
sentences.cn: 那个公司拥有380万美元的营业额。

sentences.en: The industry has a high turnover of young people.
sentences.cn: 该行业的年轻从业者流动率较高。

sentences.en: The store greatly reduced the prices to make a quick turnover.
sentences.cn: 这家商店实行大减价以迅速周转资金.

sentences.en: This store has a daily turnover of several thousand yuan.
sentences.cn: 这个商店每天有好几千元的进出.

sentences.en: We have a fast turnover of stock.

words.tran_cn: 翻领的；可翻下的；衰退的；下降的
[贸易]营业额；流通量；翻覆；半圆卷饼

phrases.tran_cn: 年营业额，年成交量；年总生物量
存货周转率；库存周转率

trans.tran_cn: 营业额，成交量，人事变更率，周转率，半圆馅饼
trans.tran_en: the amount of business done during a particular period
